member.name: T:Presto.Common.Net.TCPClient
member.summary:
A MessageType based Asynchronous TCP Client to interact with a corresponding MessageType based asynchronous Presto TCP Server. Adapted from the MSDN example at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bew39x2a.aspx
*Note The actual connection is left synchronous to avoid timing issues with the stream writes.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.TCPClient.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create the TCP Client with the specified host and port.
member.param: String representation of the host on the network.
The port to connect to on the host.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.TCPClient.#ctor(System.Net.IPEndPoint)
member.summary: Create the TCP Client with the specified host IPEndpoint.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.TCPClient.connect
member.summary: Connect the client to the given host server.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.TCPClient.write(Presto.Common.Net.MessageType,System.String)
member.summary: Write data to the socket stream according to the passed in Message Type and String message

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.TCPClient.write(Presto.Common.Net.MessageType,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Write data to the socket stream according to the passed in message type and byte data array

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.TCPClient.write(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Internal write function. Writes the passed in data to the socket stream.
member.param: the byte data to be written

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.TCPClient.writeCallback(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Internal asynchronous write callback method

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.TCPClient.dispatch(Presto.Common.Net.ClientState)
member.summary: Dispatches the recieved message to the appropriate object
member.param: The state object to be dispatched.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.TCPClient.setDispatchAction(System.String,System.Action{Presto.Common.Net.ClientState})
member.summary: Sets a dispatch action to the dispatch list and triggers that action according to the message type.
member.param: The message type from the Presto.Common.Net.MessageType struct.
An Action that recieves a server state object as its only parameter.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.TCPClient.close
member.summary: Close the client.

member.name: T:Presto.Common.Net.MessageType
member.summary: A type safe enum holding all available message types. Message types are an 8 character ASCII string passed as an identifier to the recieving end of the tcp connection as to what to dispatch the request to. THe message type will be the first 8 characters of a message in ASCII. Consequently the message type is the first 8 bytes.

member.name: F:Presto.Common.Net.MessageType.UNKOWN
member.summary: The given messange type was unknown or unparseable.

member.name: F:Presto.Common.Net.MessageType.ASSEMBLY_INCOMING
member.summary: AN assembly binary is attatched to this message.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.MessageType.#cctor
member.summary: The static constructor for the MessageType enum.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.MessageType.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Internal constructor for the type safe enum MessageType
member.param: The name of the message type.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.MessageType.ToString
member.summary: Get the name of the enumeration as a string.
member.returns: The string representation of the enumeration.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.MessageType.op_Implicit(Presto.Common.Net.MessageType)~System.String
member.summary: Implicit conversion from Message Type to String
member.returns: The string representation of the MessageType

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.MessageType.op_Implicit(System.String)~Presto.Common.Net.MessageType
member.summary: Implicitly convert from string to MessageType
member.returns: Will return null if "mtype" matches no MessageType

member.name: T:Presto.Common.Net.TCPServer
member.summary:
An asynchronous TCP server. Adapted from the MSDN example at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/fx6588te.aspx
This server allows dispatching according to the included MessageTypes structure. By simply associating message types with Actions that recieve the ServerState Object as their only paramater, we can leave the dispatching internal to the tcp server. The message types are the first 8 ASCII characters / First 8 bytes of the tcp transmission.
The server is entirely asynchronous and all dispatched actions get thrown into the thread pool.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.TCPServer.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. An asynchronous tcp socket bound to the specified port.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.TCPServer.start
member.summary: Start up the tcp server and begin accepting clients.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.TCPServer.listen
member.summary: Internal: starts up the listening loop

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.TCPServer.accept(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Internal: connect to the client and spin off a recieve callback

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.TCPServer.read(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: read data sent from the client, called recursively until all data is receieved

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.TCPServer.dispatch(Presto.Common.Net.ServerState)
member.summary: Dispatches the recieved message to the appropriate object
member.param: The state object to be dispatched.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.TCPServer.setDispatchAction(Presto.Common.Net.MessageType,System.Action{Presto.Common.Net.ServerState})
member.summary: Sets a dispatch action to the dispatch list and triggers that action according to the message type.
member.param: The message type from the Presto.Common.Net.MessageType struct.
An Action that recieves a server state object as its only parameter.

member.summary: A common log for all program errors or debug statements to be written to

member.param: The error message to be logged.

member.param: The warning message to be logged.

member.param: The generic message to be logged.

member.name: T:Presto.Common.Net.ClientState
member.summary: ServerState is a state object that gets passed around as the holder for an asynchronous socket.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.ClientState.#ctor(System.Net.Sockets.TcpClient)
member.summary: Create a new server state object to manage a currently running connection
member.param: The sync socket associated with the state object.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.ClientState.purgeBuffer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies all remaining data in the buffer into the full data array and clears the buffer.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.ClientState.getMessageType
member.summary: Extracts the message type from the message and returns it as a string. If the message is not long enough to contain a message type, null is returned. The message type is the first 8 characters of the message in ASCII so a check is simple.
member.returns: Will return the MessageType of the request, or null if the message type could not be parsed.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.ClientState.isFullyRecieved
member.summary: When a message is fully recieved an internal boolean gets set to true. This is a way for outsiders to check on that internal property.
member.returns: boolean telling if the message has been fully recieved

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.ClientState.getDataArray
member.summary: Get the data portion of the message as a byte array

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.ClientState.getDataASCIIString
member.summary: Get the data portion of the message as an ASCII encoded string

member.name: T:Presto.Common.Net.ServerState
member.summary: ServerState is a state object that gets passed around as the holder for an asynchronous socket.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.ServerState.#ctor(System.Net.Sockets.Socket)
member.summary: Create a new server state object to manage a currently running connection
member.param: The sync socket associated with the state object.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.ServerState.purgeBuffer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies all remaining data in the buffer into the full data array and clears the buffer.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.ServerState.getMessageType
member.summary: Extracts the message type from the message and returns it as a string. If the message is not long enough to contain a message type, null is returned. The message type is the first 8 characters of the message in ASCII so a check is simple.
member.returns: Will return the MessageType of the request, or null if the message type could not be parsed.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.ServerState.sendAndClose(Presto.Common.Net.MessageType,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sends the passed in data as the passed in message type and closes the socket.

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.ServerState.sendData(Presto.Common.Net.MessageType,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sends the passed in data as the passed in message type

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.ServerState.write(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Internal write function. Writes the passed in data to the socket stream.
member.param: the byte data to be written

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.ServerState.closeSocket
member.summary: Closes the ServerState's associated socket

member.name: M:Presto.Common.Net.ServerState.isFullyRecieved
member.summary: When a message is fully recieved an internal boolean gets set to true. This is a way for outsiders to check on that internal property.
member.returns: boolean telling if the message has been fully recieved

member.summary: Get the data portion of the message as a byte array
